alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 07 at 5:34PM AKST until November 08 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulation 8 to 14 inches. * WHERE...Turnagain Pass to Summit Lake. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 5 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Heavy snowfall rates could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect an initial round of light to moderate snow to develop Tuesday night with light snow accumulations likely. The snow is then expected to diminish or taper off early Wednesday morning before a second round of heavier snow develops by late Wednesday morning. This second round of potentially heavy snow will continue through mid to late Wednesday afternoon before temperatures warm and precipitation changes to rain. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely Wednesday afternoon. Rain on top of snow will likely cause ponding of water on roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
